text: Terrible. Dry corn bread. Rib tips were all fat and mushy and had no flavor. If you want bbq in this neighborhood go to john mulls roadkill grill. Trust me.

I love me some BBQ. I came upon H&H because my cousin mentioned it and since I wanted some BBQ I wanted to try this new place out. It's near the K-Mart on Rancho. 

The menu looked pretty good but for some reason the fried catfish dinner was calling my name and not so much the BBQ. But I got the best of both worlds since my bf ordered the brisket dinner plate. I did love the catfish, it was battered just right not too salty and not too bland. The dinner did come with two sides and corn bread, I got the mac n cheese and the fried okra. The mac n cheese was okay it was too dry for me and the fried okra was yummy. The corn bread it came with didn't taste like anything at all...they need some work with that. As for the brisket that I tried it was very flavorful.

Home cooking is culture.  We usually love our mama's cook'n.  Ms. Toni makes this place like you're going home to mama's--that is if you grew up in the south.  The BBQ meals are dished out the way my grandma piled it up, the employees are thoughtful.  My favorites are the brisket, macaroni and cheese, banana pudding, collards, and yams.  The cat fish is perfectly cooked too.

Tried this hidden BBQ spot yesterday since I've driven by it a few times. We ordered it to go. We were assisted by a very nice young lady. I had their Sunday special dinner special smothered oxtail dinner special with collard greens and okra. The portions are very generous between the lunch and dinner portion. Okra was salted with a light sugar taste which gave the okra nice balance of sweet and salty.  Greens were bland. I was really looking forward to the cornbread, but it was ok as it was a bit dry. 

My wife had the brisket lunch portion with Mac and Cheese along with black eyed peas. I tried it and the brisket was very good in flavor. We asked about the mac and cheese and was told that it was made from scratch. It was made from scratch, but the flavor wasn't what I expected. Cheesy, but pretty tasteless. Black Eyed Peas had no flavor and it tasted like it came out of a can. I also ordered an extra brisket for my son and I asked for potato salad and corn. They gave me mashed potatoes instead of potato salad instead. 

My daughter had the BBQ chicken and we upgraded to "white meat"which they charged us an extra dollar for, but didn't mind paying. When we got home they only gave us one chicken breast and gave us a wing. We expected all "white meat" so if you order "white meat" be specific so they don't give you a combo of white and dark. She had french fries and yams. She absolutely loved the yams! So definitely recommend that as a must get! 

Finally, we also ordered the banana bread pudding (small portion) which we almost didn't get, but the young lady who helped us chased us to our car and indicated that if we want to go through the drive thru she would get it to us. Definitely a must get! Overall, we will probably try again and try other items on the menu. I would recommend this BBQ place if you're hungry and want some "southern style flavor", but wouldn't recommend it if you're looking for a 4 or 5 experience. I will,however, change my opinion if my next time I am here the food quality changes.

I love love loved the bbq chicken and the mac and cheese at the San Diego Jazz Festival. I will definitely pay you a visit when I make my way to Vegas. My food was so good my friend had to change her mind on what she was gonna eat after she got a taste of mine. Keep doing what ur doing!

I bought a Groupon quite some time ago to use at the North Las Vegas location, and I think it was before this branch opened up.  I fell in love with their ribs and would drive all the way down there to get some.  And then I learned that they had opened a restaurant in the northwest, much closer to me.  I absolutely love their ribs.  I've ordered their plates before, but I usually just go for straight ribs.  I prefer spare ribs over babybacks because they have more flavor, even if they aren't as tender.  

Every once in a while, I will try some other Las Vegas rib joint, but so far no one has equaled H & H for flavor.

Brisket was good...mac and cheese was very good...potato salad seemed like it had good flavor but I honestly couldn't get a bite down it was served so cold it was unpleasent...maybe fridge was set a lil too high or whatever...the food and one side was worth me trying again I'd really like to try the potato salad again if that isn't how it is traditionally served

H&H Plus 2 is "Like a Box of Chocolates"...you never know what your going to get. What I mean is, when my daughter brought a bbq rib tip family dinner home from H&H, it was delicious! Prefect in every way. The meat was tender, juicy, and well seasoned. The potato salad, greens, yams, and corn bread were great! 

I was so happy to have a bbq place within walking distance of my house that has good food. Well, now I'm disappointed because after waiting a whole week and thinking about how good the food was,  I went to get a dinner and the meat was unevenly
 seasoned and unevenly cooked. I couldn't even chew most of the pieces because the meat was too tough. I had to give it to my cat and she even had a had time tearing the meat apart. 

What makes me even more upset is that I gave a tip based on the food my daughter brought to me but had I known that I wouldn't get to enjoy my meal....well, if I had known that I was getting a crappy meal, I wouldn't have bought it, let alone given a tip.

Too bad H&H PLUS 2, I probably would have been your best customer but now I can't take a chance on spending so much money on food that may end up in my cat's belly. #ABoxOfChocolates!

I'm not one to write reviews unless I feel like I need to, with that said, with the food experience I just had, I have to say that I just had the biggest foodgasm of my life. 

I ordered the pulled pork dinner combo and it came with a heeping pile of pulled pork smothered in BBQ sauce. The Mac and cheese was made with cheesy perfection and the candid yams were sweet and savory at the same time. I couldn't help literally shoving everything in my mouth, it was that good! I will definitely have to venture out here, the next time a BBQ craving arises.

I'm sorry to see that this place has had some bad reviews because we enjoyed our meal. I got the lunch portion of BBQ chicken with mac n cheese and ranch beans sides and my husband got the lunch portion of ribs with potato salad and french fries. My chicken was very good, smoky and had a delicious BBQ sauce on it. The mac n cheese was tasty, but, as other reviewers have said, it was a little bit on the dry side. It needs a little more sauce to make it creamier. The ranch beans had pieces of bacon in them and had a nice smoky flavor. My husband said his ribs were very good and the BBQ sauce on them was also good. I didn't try his potato salad, but he said he enjoyed it. He commented that the fries were a little bit soggy, but tasty. The corn muffins were light and crumbly. Overall, it was a good meal and we will definitely try H & H BBQ Plus 2 again.

Catfish delicious. Light..perfectly cooked.
Sweet potatoes  very good..
"PULLED PORK" ISN'T PULLED. IT IS CHOPPED INTO BIG CHUNKS.
Will return for catfish only!!!!

I tried this BBQ today at lunch for the first time and will not be going back. I ordered the tri tip ribs, french fries and slaw. The slaw was ok, the french fries were loaded with black pepper and the tri tips were inedible. The tips were so tough that I could barely get any meat off them. There were a couple in the bottom that were not just tough, but also stringy like shoe leather. I ended up throwing the entire meal in the garbage and walking out.

First time trying this place. Been looking for a good BBQ place and I must say, we were a bit disappointed.  I try to use Yelp as a guide before trying new places and this place had so many mixed reviews I had to try it for myself. 
We ordered our food to go.
Four people's opinions.
Brisket- was more like overdone roast beef. I have never seen brisket sliced the way this was sliced.
Pulled pork sandwich- tasteless, was supposed to have coleslaw on it but it didn't. Very little BBQ sauce was on it so there was no disguising the tasteless flavor.
Mac & cheese- the quantity was not worth the money (not even an ice cream scoops worth). Dry and boring.
French fries- Ore Ida? 
Greens - Good
Coleslaw- mayonnaise based. Not a fan. Nothing special.
Ribs- Good. Fall off the bone good. Sauce was ok but again nothing special.
Fried Okra- Good.
Cornbread- my cornbread was burnt, I mean black burnt. I can't believe they actually put it in my to go box. Others were very dry. 
We might retun to try other things and order the ribs again but probably not anytime soon.
But let me end in saying the gal at the counter was extremely nice.

THIS PLACE IS AMAZING.......H&H BBQ plus 2 has been my weekly staple for months. Don't believe the LIES listed below. My food is ALWAYS HOT!!!!  SAVORY!!!! TENDER!!!!  and DELICIOUS. 

I just love their rib dinner. I get a HUGE portion of ribs every time.......and plenty of BBQ sauce. With 2 sides included I'm a sucker for their Candied Yams & Mac & Cheese.

Quality Food that you can taste.......EVERYONE that works there cares a lot about the food, service, & ensuring my overall experience is GOLDEN.   

TRY THEM!!!!    You won't be disappointed!!

Ok now for all you BBQ lovers out there let me tell you this , you can't lose by selecting this place for some good southern comfort food and when I say southern, I mean that good southern california back yard BBQ. That love and care you taste from grandpa and dad on the grill making it extra tender and juicy with patience.  With your aunt and mom in the kitchen peeling potatoes for potato salad with smiles and laughter. With grandma and one of the little cousins on the patio picking and curling off the collard greens in the pots looking out to all the family love and enjoying the ambiance of family get togethers.

This is everything I felt with every bite I had.  I will DEFINETLY tell you when it comes to southern food and BBQ , I am hard to please! This place has it gift wrapped for you foodies! " Gift Wrapped " ! I was not only taken back by the spacious and wonderfully cleaned restaurant, I too was greeted with a beautiful smiling woman who knew how to present the menu to me in its entirety. She turns around to the menu and explained so clearly to me,  what each category and meal had to offer . I was truly amazed by her thoroughness.  These days it is very hard to find clarity with any type of purchase.  So for me it was very enlightening. 

Back to the restaurant,  they have a wide open kitchen. I saw stainless steel for days. I can see their establishment is very clean and organized. As well as a very nice touch to be so transparent.  There is just something that erk's me about someone walking through a single door to get my food. . Lol 
I love that they have a variety of different tables inside to sit at. They have what appears to be a banquet room, that has a glass window partition all around it.  Lovely! I just really love the retro feel and look of this restaurant. For it to be sooo clean and look like new it's a pleasure to be in. I wish I want in such a hurry I would have stayed to eat . I tell you this though I will be back very soon and will definitely sit down and enjoy my meal.  
Before I forget to tell you I had the 3 pc combo meal with chicken, ribs, hot links, that came with two side ( collard greens,  potato salad) and a corn bread. All of which was very impressive! They have Pepsi self serve soda fountain products.  Now when have you ever seen a soul food place show Love like that? ?  I would choose this place and drive the extra miles any day over Lucille's any day. Lucille's became to dry and unappealing. Especially the lard apple butter. Yuk!  

OK also I got the catfish dinner which was very, very good too. 
So if your craving some good back home BBQ that only selected few can master the taste and texture and juiciest ribs ever,  you will be crazy not to partake this place. 
This establishment definitely has priority go to on my list. 

By the way , my daughter told me later she observed that the lady who greeted is was actually the owner. So I give the lovely owner Tony Terrell a special shot out, " You are Awesome!  Thanks for the LOVE!!!

VERY RUDE PEOPLE! Came in a little after 6:30 and the cook got upset with me because they close at 7pm. He said "you knew you were hungry at 4pm, why would you wait til now to come in". And then proceeds to tell me that I can only order barbecue (because he didn't want to make anything else) and anything I get, I'll have to PAY TWICE.. Then the young girl behind the register backs him up "he's serious". I used to like this place and came quite often. But you're not the only bbq place in town.. I'd rather spend my money were the employees aren't rude for no reason. You sir, are an asshole and a son of an ugly bitch. You will never get my/my friends business again. If you hate your job, quit.. don't spread your misery around.

I'm done with this place! It's going downhill and has been for some time. When I showed up tonight, the place is empty and I walk up to order. Half the stuff I wanted, they were out of. No yams, no greens, no Mac n cheese and to top it off, their credit card machine doesn't work and they wanted me to go get cash from an ATM and come back. 
Screw that and I'll be taking my business elsewhere. Some of the stuff they could make but she said it would take a min of 30 mins. 
If you're running low on something, you may want to get a new batch in the making. You all come across like you just don't want to make more and hope the customer just picks another side and moves on. 
After the long list of stuff you didn't have tonight, I'm done with this place!

This place is amazing. I came at the end of lunchtime and had the fried catfish. It was freshly made to order, flavorful, crispy and tender.  The fried okra was perfectly crunchy and potato salad was creamy and tangy. All of it was delicious and the lunch portions were generous. The staff is friendly and helpful with their recommendations. I am definitely going to come back!

Decided to give this place a shot since the BBQ place down the way had closed its doors for good.  The BF and I were craving a BBQ sandwich for lunch so we were on a mission.  As we pulled up the parking was pretty full.  We thought that was a good sign to start.  Upon walking in we were greeted by a pretty young lady who asked if it was our first time there.  She explained the menu to us and the first thing I noticed was no BBQ Chicken sandwich.  All kinds of other sandwiches but no chicken.  Bummer.  My hopes just flew out the window.

In place of my craving for a chicken sandwich I ordered the BBQ pork sandwich with the slaw on the side and fries.  The BF ordered the BBQ brisket sandwich with mac and cheese.  The kids menu was weird for kids I thought.  The options were chicken, fish and something else.  I thought "oh boy" the daughter is not gonna want any of this but she just went with the chicken.  

We found a table and waited for our food to be prepared.  The place was real clean.  There were like three other tables occupied.  It was really warm in the restaurant which made it a little unpleasant being that we were trying to escape from the 110 degree weather.  They had a little party room which was closed off.  The place used to be an old Burger King so the little room looked like it was the old play area.

They called our name and went up to get our food.  As I was helping the daughter with trying to de-bone her chicken the family was digging on my French fries.  Wait a minute-I want those! Hi.  Before I could even look at my food I decided to order more fries and we needed a side of BBQ sauce.  I went up to the counter and ordered up the large fries and a side of BBQ sauce.  For a BBQ joint I was actually surprised that they actually charged me for the sauce.  Still scratching my head.

Here is a rundown of our meals:

Pork Sandwich with slaw on the side - The roll was cold, which I felt should have been toasted or warmed up and the pork was kind of fatty.  The slaw I didn't even eat.  

BBQ Brisket Sandwich with mac and cheese - Same kinda thing...cold roll, meat was a little better tastewise than the pork but still fatty.  The BF didn't care for the slaw and the mac and cheese was pretty darn yummy.  Both sandwiches didn't have enough sauce which is why we needed a side of sauce.

(Kids) BBQ chicken on the bone with corn on the cob - Chicken was great - We ordered white meat and it was a huge piece and the meat was tender and smokey. (aside from that I still think that the bones in a kids meal isn't that good of an idea)  She ate up the corn as that is always a hit for her.

Now for the star of the day - French Fries! - .they were the wrinkle style and were cooked perfectly-not too done and a little soft in the middle.  They were sprinkled with some kind of seasoning that made it a salty sweet.  Amazing with a unique taste.  The large fry we thought was gigantic (and $5.00).  It was so good we ate every last bite!  Enough said.

The sauce - had a little kick to it, was very thick and is served warm.  Still funny that they would charge us for a side.  It was pretty good though.

The service was good.  The girl taking our order was very nice as well as one of the cooks who made some conversation with me. I definitely think we will try this again....maybe stay away from the sandwiches next time.  I do think they should add a BBQ chicken sandwich still...still a little bummed about that....

This is 2nd time hubby & I've ate here, very good. he had lunch plate, catfish ,& I had 2meat lunch plate pulled pork &beef brisket. We prefer it over Famous Daves or John Mulls. The place is always clean & service is very friendly.

My husband took my for bbq.  Decent bbq.  Ribs are tasty and tender.  The brisket is tender and fatty - the way it should be.  Have been looking forward to trying their ox tails  which are only served on Sundays.  Finally got a chance to try them.  My favorite.  Very, very tender and tasty.  Will definitely be back.
Bomb. My yams, mac and cheese,  the breading on the fish wasnt my favorite but it was still good.. i enjoyed everything.

I've ate here three times already. The first two I got the lunch pulled pork sandwich with side. Tonight I got the 2-meat dinner which came with 2 sides and a corn muffin for $14.99. I got a size able amount of pulled pork which was moist and the barbecue sauce is great. I also got pork ribs which had a good dry rub on the outside.  The staff have been really nice each visit. Great food and customer service in my opinion.

Is this $8 worth of ribs i've been coming here for a year straight at least once a week y'all never did me like this  I gave you four stars because the food is very good but this I'm done with h&h  I kept my mouth shut about how last week you guys practically gave me only bone in my rib tip DINNER $12 for a plate full of bones with two pieces that had meat y'all not going to keep playing me disappointed faithful customer


Update :
I'm so happy that mama or somebody came back in town to make sure business was running right because they are back to being the best in Vegas I still and always will come here !!!!
Great food at an incredible price. Ribs are very good. The Sunday dinner lasted until Monday. The cornbread was dry.
I liked this place. Some good options and I had the brisket which was good. I look forward to returning and sampling more of their menu. Priced well and good portions in my opinion
Very good pork ribs and terrific sauce.  Nice staff and customers.  Ya gotta love a place that serves ribs and catfish with a full roll of paper towels on every table.  Would definitely go back.
This is serious the best BBQ place ever!! the owner is really nice whenever she in the building she always makes sure she greets us, great customer service, and the food is delicious,

We went in tonight about 30 minutes before closing and had the brisket, hot links and pulled pork.  For sides we had the Fried Okra, Ranch Beans and mac-n-cheese.  The food was amazing, the pulled pork and brisket was very tender and the bbq sauce was amazing.  Aside from the food being great the restaurant was very clean.  The owners were both there and waited on us, good people to say the least.   I highly recommend this place.

Came here with the family looking for some good bbq and it didn't disappoint. Brisket and pulled pork were great, not dry at all. Portions were huge and drenched in bbq sauce that had good kick and flavor but didn't overpower the taste of the meat. Sides were ok. Would definitely go back

Customer service was lousy. I almost left without ordering because no one had greeted me for almost 10 minutes, even though there were two employees there. They both walked passed me a few times without acknowledging my presence at all. Finally the guy from behind a wall yelled something out. I had no idea he was talking to me. He poked his head out from behind the wall as if he was becoming impatient that I hadn't yelled back. I told him that I had been wanting to try the food her for a while. He offered no suggestions or details. Just starred at me wide eyed waiting for me to order. If the food had been good, I could have forgiven the lousy service.  The food was straight up, BAD. Driest Chicken I have ever had. Bummer. I was really wanting to like this place.

Pulled pork Sandwich Dank as Hell! filled my oldest Teenage monster perfect! My pops Grubbed down the brisket dinner he was purring like a king lion!!! The seasoned french fries were super tasty!! Bbq Chicken Kids meal was good... just size! Big party's hard to sit... Soda Machine down but the made it up!!! Awesome service good price for a dank Munchie madness satisfyer!!

I wish we could give NEGATIVE stars!!! Everyday I drive past this business, the parking lot appears empty. Now I think I know why? I decided to drop in and order something....BOY WAS I QUICKLY DISAPPOINTED!!! "I'd like to order some macaroni and"...."WE OUT OF MACARONI"!!! "Ok....Well let me get some bbq chick"....."WE OUTTA CHICKEN" "Oooookkkkk"...."Can a brutha get a mint and two straws"? "WE OUTTA STRAWS AND DON'T SERVE MINTS AND IF WE DID, WE'D BE OUTTA THEM AS WELL"!!!

Went to this place to check it out and it wasn't the best nor was it the worst. I had their bbq brisket with yams and each beans. The yams were amazing and I surprisingly liked the ranch beans even though I'm not really a beans dish lover. The brisket fell apart so it was tender but I felt like it was missing a little flavor. My friend had pulled pork with fried okra and mac-n-cheese. The fried okra was super delicious, I've personally never really ate okra before until this time, I really wanted to just order more because it blew me away! The mac-n-cheese was good too, made from scratch. But the pulled pork wasn't to my liking. It was really dry even with the bbq sauce they put in top. The corn bread they gave with the meal was a little hard and burnt. We also tried banana pudding and peach cobbler. Now those desserts blew my mind! They were so delicious! Really good customer service as well.

-10 stars...This was my fourth time but it had been a while since my last visit.  The first time I went in the food was awesome. Fresh and a lot of it.  I later wonder if that's the gimmick to have patrons come back. My second and third was not great but not too bad. I thought the third time would have been my last. Today I visit because I really wanted bbq and my first choice was John Mulls but of course they were closed. I settled for H &H hoping it would be like the first time. I ordered 3 meat combo: ribs, links, and brisket.  While I'm waiting, I hear only one person but apparently having a conversation with her employees.  I was wondering why was she so loud. What happens in her place of business and behind the scenes should not be public info. Meanwhile, there are a few customers eating. When my order comes up, I check my order and was surprised to see the hot links were chopped to pieces and looked more like a hot dog texture. The brisket had over an inch of fat and less than half an inch of meat attached to it.  I asked the gentleman did they change because my hot links were usually a whole link. The gentleman didn't get the chance to respond before the loud female yells out "I'm the owner and this is how it's always been done and how would you like it done?" I can tell then that was a real effort for her to even ask me that question. I told her whole. As I was trying to mention the fat on the brisket she became hostile.  "Well I trim all that off but that's how it comes and what more do you want me to do for you?" My response was my money back. She yelled out give her her money back. Told me I was a N***** at least 3 times or more in front of everyone.  Told me I was being sh*tty. She has a loud and overpowering voice. I never cursed at her or called her any racial remarks. I was shocked. I couldn't get my phone out fast enough because I really wanted to record her. I am so appalled. I felt humiliation, embarrassment, and degradation.  After reading the previous reviews of those that had bad customer service seem to have had the run in with the same person. I have never felt so disrespected in my entire life. It truly hurts because it came from one black female to another as if we don't have enough struggles.

Just awful. My hot dog bun on my beef hot link sandwich was dry, the link seemed as though it had been sitting for a while because the outside casing was really, really tough. It's a good thing it was drenched in bbq sauce or it would have been really dry as well. The mac and cheese was dry, but I have to admit it was at least somewhat flavorful. Overall not worth the $6.99 I spent. I hear the other place gives you corn bread? Well, not this one. 

Don't even think about getting the banana pudding. It's literally vanilla wafers and sliced fresh bananas in a soupy, liquid that taste like condensed milk. There is nothing "pudding" about it. 

Unlike others, I would not give this place another try. Just not worth the quality, price or stomach space.

Went here today after church for some lunch. Looked at the menu for a bit before deciding what exactly to order. I ended up getting the $8 lunch size rip tip platter  with mac&cheese and black eyes peas. 
Didn't wait long at all before they called my order up. I decided to eat some of it there. It's a nice size portion of food for a lunch size. FYI : no drink is included with these platters.
The food was pretty good and tasty. I really liked the black eyes peas and mac&cheese. 
The only downfall I would comment on is that the food is a tad bit too oily for me.....you'll really notice it as you get to the bottom of your container. Also,  the rib tips are really fatty. The fat on the tips is equal, if not more, to the amount of meat. 
Other than that, it's a cool place. Sidenote: there's a random, separate room within the sitting area. The room has couches in it and chairs set up like a different business. It looks weird lol.

WOW, while in Vegas enjoying some down time I wanted to eat at local places since I had been burned out by all the food on the strip. My sister recommended this place because she had previously stumbled into Fremont street and they were having a BBQ festival. She said they could be the best ribs she has ever had. Naturally when I hear the best I hype it up myself. This place surpassed whatever expectations I had hyped up myself. The portions were huge we had enough for dinner for 2 people and then some. Next time I Visit Las Vegas this will be one of my first stops I make for food. I had the ribs, brisket, chicken and each was stupendous!!!!

Im in Vegas from LA and I found H and H BBQ baaaby this is some good BBQ.  You can taste all the flavor of the seasoning, sauce and the smoke!  The mac n cheese is of the chain. Yams are homemade! Boy o boy that fried okra yummmmy! I will be back!

I tried H and H last night, and found it to be just okay. The Mac and cheese, pulled pork and bbq chicken were pretty good. The catfish was very salty which made it hard to eat. The tri tip ribs hardly had any meat on them,so I couldn't tell you if they were good or not.

Had lunch here yesterday with a friend of mine and let me tell you this was the bomb.com

I know soul food and I know my BBQ and this was so on point. I had the BBQ chicken ( the chicken was perfect moist and the right amount of char and you can tell it can fresh off the pit) lunch special that comes with 2 sides and cornbread $6.99, keep in mind you have to buy the drinks separately. My friend ordered the 2 meat combo platter and she had the hot links and brisket . The BBQ sauce on the links and the chicken was so darn good. The collard greens, yams and Mac and cheese was on the money. The only thing that I thought could've used some fixing was the cornbread, it was a bit dry for my liking . We spent a grand total of $35- that included lunch, drinks and desserts.

The service here was amazing, the women behind the counter were very friendly and always smiling. I'm happy that h&h is back and in a better location, let's say I was pretty upset when I found out the original one closed down . Oh if you have room left for dessert-  the peach cobbler is where it's at ! 

PS. There's a Drive-thru, if you're too lazy to go inside .

I'll definitely be back ladies !

What a surprise this place was.  I'm from Cali, will be moving to Vegas soon.  I've been searching for decent BBQ throughout the West for years, haven't found much good BBQ west of Texas.  I was driving around Vegas looking for a lunch spot and literally stumbled upon H & H.  I ordered the chicken and ribs combo.  Damn, that was a lot of food.  
I never order ribs with sauce on them, in my opinion it's just a cover for meat that doesn't have much flavor. It was a busy day for me so I wasn't thinking and forgot to ask for sauce on the side until I noticed the sauce being poured on the ribs.  Damn.
They did not, however, drown the ribs in sauce and actually the bottom pieces didn't have any sauce, great.  These ribs do not need sauce, the flavor actually came through even with the sauce and the bones without sauce were really, really good.  Nice smokey flavor, visible smoke ring and very tender but not too tender.  The chicken was great too, very tender, I could eat it with a fork.  The sides were very good to but I was focused on the meats.  My plate had two huge breasts and a wig along with I think 5 ribs.
Best place I've had in Vegas so far and I've been to a lot there.  Everybody I talk to mentions Rollin Smoke and John Mulls, both are not very good, this place beats them hands down.  I see a few reviews mention consistency may be an issue, I've discovered that with a lot of places but I can only go by my first impression and it was very good for H $ H, I'll be back!
Great place. Catfish and brisket was extremely good.  Also the kool-aid. The customer service was great and food served fast.

Felt like I was at home with grandma having lunch. 
So nice to see a place like this doing great. 
Hope the best for ur business!!

So good I came two days in a row. First I had the short ribs lunch special, next day I ordered the catfish lunch special. Might I add I was able picked all over my invitees' plate of chicken and brisket. I even took a plate home for my sister lol. I'll be back soon I just can't get enough and the prices are very reasonable.
For all that r looking catfish buyers beware of places this advertising catfish but actually giving BASA or SWAY

I was drawn into (Hicks & Hines), better known as H&H BBQ by an unstoppable force, I felt like Han Solo being pulled into the Death Star by the tractor beam. My cousins Big Mike & Sarah had told me this place was great and man were they ever right! I ordered the lunch special which was priced just right. I chose pork ribs, mac n cheese, coleslaw (because I'm a slaw fiend), and cornbread on the side. Before I ate I chatted with the owner Toni and she told me the food was so good that it would put me to sleep. She was right. All I needed was a pillow and a blanket and I would have surely been snoring, then surely asked to leave their fine establishment. The food was ridiculous! The pork ribs were smoked to perfection. The mac n cheese was just crazy! It was full of flavor. The slaw was excellent, it had a creamy consistency. Cornbread simply great. So, I had to meet the chefs after this great meal. I met C.L. & Larry and let them know they had skills. If you haven't been to H&H BBQ, you are missing out. Just get in your car and go right now. I just found a new favorite spot.
Really good place too eat. I was definitely suprised with their collard greens. Price varies but I would recommend the lunch special.
Awesome barbq. Service was excellent and got my order fast.  I am so glad I found this place, I will be back again for sure.

As BBQ and southern cooking go this place is OK. For the price there are better places in town. Big portions and good flavor are overshadowed by the use of way to much salt and meat that was warm covered in hot BBQ sauce. Kool-aid on the menu is a nice touch.

The one star is for the slaw. It was the only thing we ate that was good. 
I had pork and rib tips. The pork had lots of hard outside and fat in it. About half actually. The rib tips were worse. They were 90% overcooked marrow and fat and very little tough meat. The cornbread was sad! Not even worth eating. I think it had been sitting out all day. A so-called "southern" BBQ joint and no sweet tea?? What's up w that? 
May sound petty but we asked for ketchup and she gave us a few packs and there  were 3 different company's generic packs represented! If u are gonna charge $40 for BBQ at least buy "real" condiments! This town needs a real BBQ joint! One and done!

The Hubby and I finally stopped by,  and I am impressed!  Very, very clean which is so  important. The woman at the counter was very nice and explained all of the offerings. 
  We chose the rib, pulled pork, and catfish dinners with the following sides: greens, Mac and cheese, cole slaw, potato salad, yams, black eye peas. 
I grew up cooking and eating real southern food as those are my roots and growing up on the east coast. This place is "the truth!"
Generous portions, good layered flavor and the meats are tender.  The Mac and cheese can use a ill work, but I am biased as that is my best dish. The peach cobbler was also tasty. 
We will back for sure. This is a spot to keep the menu in the glove compartment.

Have driven by this place many times, my wife and I decided to give it a try tonight. Walking into the establishment it smelled like old frying oil. The staff was very unfriendly as it took five minutes for anyone to even aknowledge us. My wife ordered the chicken combo with potato salad, and I the pulled pork sandwich with fries. The chicken was so dry we could barely swallow it without something to drink. The potato salad was a joke more like cold mashed potatoes. The pulled pork was decent, but the bbq sauce tasted like they went to the kmart behind them and picked out the cheapest one they could find. I gave 2 stars because the food was hot, but unfortunately the fries were the best thing.

I love H&H BBQ I've only ordered a full slab with no sides and a large Hot Link then go home and make my own sides. The BBQ is tender with the right amount of smokiness and grill flavor. I usually call in the order and it is ready for me when I get there. No complaints here, I'm glad there is one near me!!!

The food is amazing as always! I've known Hank since I was a kid, and he and he's wife could always burn in the kitchen! Customer service was awesome, and very comical! The banana pudding is to die for!  A very clean establishment!  5 stars from EbonyJordan

I was hoping they would be better than the one on LV blvd. NOT. the peach cobbler was totally burned.  don't even know why they bothered to sell that to anybody. the mac and cheese as usual is over cooked. i tried. i can't.

The Bbq is wonderful and very flavorful, not over smoked or cooked, the beans are similar to what i make and the mac n cheese is not greasy like others I've had, i had pulled pork moist and full of flavor, the candied yams are excellent, would I recommend this place to family and friends YES!!!! Thanks for the great food can't wait to come back.

It's hit or miss. The food is generally pretty good but can be mediocre at times. I'm a rib tips guy and I have had really good and succulent tips here, but have also had overcooked, dry ones. I also would recommend getting the soda machine going rather than cans of soda for guests. Staff is very friendly and hospitable. Like being at a family member's house.

The place doesn't look like much from the outside but the inside is extremely clean. All four employees were really friendly and nice. The BBQ sauce is super good. All our food was really tasty. We will definitely make the trip across  town again.

I had been craving southern style, bbq food for so long but there is never any great places out here with good food & customer service. The food here reminded me of being back at home licking my fingers from the bbq. We ordered catfish, potato salad, mac & cheese, hot links, yams & collard greens. Everything was delicious! It's down the street from my house. Decent prices + lunch specials! We will be back. Please stay in business! :)

Food is always good and fresh and the customer service is excellent. ..always friendly.  Even used their catering service for an event ...they served as well...food and everything  was perfect.  HIGHLY recommend them.

I love coming here atleast once a week to count on delicious home cooked meals! Makes me think of my home cooking...close to home when I eat...Georgia girl!
I love their Mac and cheese and I am picky! Lol

This place is not bad. The guy,Angel, was very friendly and helpful. I don't love the location and I did feel some kind of way that there was only 1 other person in there beside me. But I will say everything was very good, except the cornbread. It was dry. But I would definitely go again.

H and H 2 BBQ is a relative newcomer to the area of Rancho and Craig Roads...it is an old Burger King restaurant and does not offer any waitress service. I ordered two of the combos, pulled pork and beef brisket, to go. For the sides I ordered the beans, potato salad, black eye peas and collard greens. The combos also came with a muffin. The order took approximately fifteen minutes to complete, there was only one woman working the counter and there were several other staff members in the back. There was a guy doing some of the cooking on several grills in the parking lot next to the building. The pulled pork was pretty tasty, the potato salad just okay and the beans slightly above average, the corn bread muffin was a joke. The second combo of beef brisket was a disgrace and if I hadn't ordered it to go it would have gone back to the kitchen. The beef brisket contained an inordinate amount of fat, nasty and should not have been served to us....the collard greens were good but a tad on the salty side, the black eye peas were above average. The prices are average for the portion sizes that are given to you....I may give this place another shot but I was really hoping that it would be a hidden gem, unfortunately it wasn't ....

We had great food here! We had the 5 meats, catfish, Macaroni and cheese, corn on the cob and greens, everything was great! The only reason I did not give 5 stars was the lack of table service, I do not like ordering like a fast food restaurant and I don't leave tips in a tip jar where I have to carry the food to the table myself and get up and refill my own drinks. I guess I will have to go through the drive thru from now on.

I love barbecue and have been meaning to try this place for about a year. I was put off because there never seem to be any customers and the reviews complaining about the service. 

If you want smooth, efficient, basic food and service, go to Famous Dave's or something. This place is an experience, not just a restaurant. 

I went in for lunch today. There were two customers waiting for their food and one of them told me that if I came for brisket, I was out of luck. That's too bad, because I was planning to get brisket.  I ended up with two beef hot links, coleslaw, and green beans (not on the list of sides, but subbed for collard greens). I asked for no bread and unsweetened tea. They don't offer that, just sweet tea. 

This is a neighborhood place and they seem to run out of popular things. That's how it goes. My meal was great, except for the corn bread, which was dry. The service was very polite and I barely had to wait.  Keep this in mind: when you get your food from chain bbq places, does the guy behind the counter sing along with the radio with the voice of an angel? Do the other customers weigh in on your food choices helpfully?

Just tried H&H plus2 yesterday for the first time. As stated in other reviews, the building it's in is a old failed Burger King! Being this is a older area of the far North West, I was very excited to see a new business taking a chance on a older established building, not just moving to the nice new edge of town. Too many businesses abandon buildings and move to newer areas, like Timbers Bar and Grill did with their location on Ann & Simmons! Now a abandoned shanty. 

Getting back on track here, Sorry!
    
    The menu - Upon first glance I was a bit confused, not very reader friendly but after the very nice women behind the counter gave me a brief explanation it started to make sense. So I CAN order off the lunch menu at dinner time? Okay!

   All the staples were there, Brisket, pulled pork, chicken, catfish, hot links, Ribs! Lookin' good! Sides include, fried okra, mac n cheese, black eyed peas, baked beans, collared greens corn on the cob, french fries and rice with gravy. There is really too much on the menu to entirely list. including a section of sandwiches I didn't even get a chance to look at. I did see a Catfish Po Boy however.  I went with the brisket... After taking my order and getting my orange soda it was explained to me the brisket wouldn't be done for 15-20 minutes! BALLS!!! 

   Okay round 2, pulled pork with mac n cheese and baked beans it is. The pork was flavor full and juicy, drizzled on top was a delicious and bold BBQ sauce. The BBQ sauce being just drizzled as opposed to mixed into the pork was a nice touch. It lets you sample the pork as it is by itself. Which was juicy and flavorful. No complaints there, A+!

   The Mac n Cheese was good, a bit dry but definitely had the qualities of a true home made Mac n Cheese, not some boxed gooey mess and nothing a lil' table side Louisiana hot sauce won't fix! I give it a solid B! The baked beans were good also. Nothing fancy, but exactly what I expected when I ordered. 

  The meal also comes with a little muffin of corn bread. Now not being a corn bread fan I don't have much to compare it too. I did try it tho. It didn't seem quite as sweet as I remember, but the sweetness of cornbread is what I dislike! I took that little muffin and soaked up every last morsel of anything left on that plate! Nothing to waste here!

 The portion size was perfect for a single meal, and like I stated earlier I order off the lunch menu which includes smaller portions. 

  After finishing up I did have just one problem. So I asked the nice cashier if I could speak with a manager. After hearing a bit of griping coming from the back of house about who wanted to speak with her, a women approached me, identified herself as the manger and with a smile asked me what she could help me with?
 
   I explained to her I just finished my meal and did have one complaint! With a very disconcerting look asked me what my issue was. I explained to her that my complaint was... "This meal was TOO DAMN GOOD and she has forced me to have to come back!" We all had a good laugh, she thanked me and I left happier than a Pig in... Well definitely happier than the delicious pig in that BBQ sauce! Great job guys!

Mediocre at best. I had the rib tips they were fatty and bland. Also if you have kids don't even go here!! My son grabbed one of their newspapers they had on a stand there the owner freaked out and said if I didn't discipline my son she would. They basically wanted me to spank my son right then and there. We don't allow bad kids in our restaurant is what they said. My kids are no angels by any means, but they were not miss behaving in the restaurant.
Great food. The catfish was outstanding. Melts in your mouth. Mac and cheese was superb. We also had the Pork Ribs, Fries and Beef Brisket. It was all amazing. Service and staff were very friendly.

Terrible customer service from (we found out later) THE OWNER's kids. When we arrived nobody was behind the register but two people were sitting at a table. SEVERAL minutes after entering, someone yells asking us if we're ready to order. I have no clue where the voice is coming from and it's the dude sitting. We order and they are soooooo rude and loud. The man cussed continuously talking about his "hoe b*tches" and mf's like they were the only people in there. I asked him if he would watch his language to which he replied "Oh I didn't know it offended anyone." Smh. Once our food was ready, the girl asked if we wanted tartar sauce and as she's giving it to us, we hear her say something about mom needing to buy more. On our way out the man apologizes for his language and we left. We always eat there but we won't return again. It really was a hot mess and according to the previous reviews, this isn't new, we were just lucky

It was 150 PM and no chicken or greens. 
The cornbread was old and the rib tips were so tough.
The cashier handle money then food without washing hands or using gloves.

Well if you saw my Hogs Heaven review you will know how I ended up here on a Sunday night literally 4 minutes before they closed. Now let me say this wasn't my 1st  or 2nd choice but considering the disastrous adventure I had been on to find BBQ this would have to do and thankfully I made it to them just in time. 

The place is a simple fast food looking place with a soda machine and some places to sit and eat. I think someone who reviewed it said it was an old Burger King so its interesting the kitchen is wide open and you can see everything. This is a family run business for sure....the young lady who took my order polite but I would say a pleasant personality is the daughter of the lady who owns the place. How do I know well she called her mother to give her the tale of the tap at the end day and also to share with her older brother the head cook her mother directives. So, it was nice to know I was supporting a small family run business. 

1st let me start by saying the restaurant was very clean it is clear they take pride in cleanliness which is very important. The menu was rather simple and start forward so I ordered the half slab which comes with 2 sides. They were close to closing and had run out of somethings but when I asked for fried okra without hesitation they fried up a fresh serving. Again the cashier was short on personality but very accommodating and polite. The food was prepared quickly and the cook (the owners son) let me and the other couple out and was very gracious wishing us a good and thanking us for coming in. So for service I would say they do a good job. 

Now about the food...the fried okra was hot, fresh and delicious! The corn muffin they give you was very tasty. Th fries were just fries ok. The most important part the ribs. Well I'll start by saying the sauce was very good sweet with a slight tang. The ribs were cooked really well the meat pulled right off the bone but didn't fall off the bone so you know they were grilled/smoked and not boiled. I hate places that boil the ribs then throw it on the grill for grill marks and call themselves a rib place. 

Even though everything was tasty I have to say the meat was really fatty! I'm not sure if that is just what is out there currently due drought issues and the bacon scare we had last year but they really need to look for a another purveyor because the ribs were easily 50% fat or more. No matter how great the service, how presentable the place, how good the sides or how well you cook the meat. If the quality is low there is nothing you can do to fix that.

Would I come back here....not until I try this rolling smoke place 1st and probably a few other places 1st to determine if this is the best the Valley has to offer.
This place is great. Food was delicious and the customer service was fantastic! Definitely coming back here.

Love this place....... As long as you see the owner there. The best BBQ  I've had in Vegas by far, as long as you see the owner there. Let me explain, I have eaten there a bunch of times, but unfortunatly the only time we go now is for lunch. There is a flavor difference between day and night is night and day! The pride in the BBQ is awesome finger licking and portion sizes Wow! The ribs are off the chain. Hot links is bomb, and you must get the catfish poboy! Yum!

Whoa! Seriously this place is a joke. They were out of collard greens.... so we opted for green beans based on the guys suggestion. The yams were canned and mostly soupy with small pieces. The sweet tea was way too sweet and no lemon to help. Fountain drinks were out so it was that or canned soda or a overpriced water bottle. The Cornbread was bland but they had no honey to offset or help the flavor and let me tell you! The catfish was 3 scrawny pieces. I've never had that small of a serving of catfish for that price. I could have spent what I spent there and went to WINCO and bought fish. But that's what you get when you're looking for lunch while out. Overall the experience with the food and service was horrible. He acted like we were bothering him. I didn't dare ask if they had any heat,on a cold day it was pretty uncomfortable eating in the cold. I'll never go back.

Had pulled pork two weeks ago and this time beef brisket. Both were delicious.  I don't really like catfish but I tried some and wow. I'll only try it here. The serve is outstanding as well. Very friendly and helpful.

I went in H&H to inquire about having a family luncheon there to honor my son and daughter in law who are about to have their 1st baby and live out of town.  I spoke to Toni who was a total gem!  She gave me a great deal & was so sweet.  I ended up staying and talking to Toni for about an hour.  The day of the baby brunch I was shocked to walk into the party room and see how Toni's daughter decorated.   It was so perfect and she did an amazing job with the decorations.   Toni and her staff stayed in the room with us to make sure our plates and drink cups were full.  It was supposed to be buffet style but often time the staff brought us our food.  They are hands down the most generous and polite group of people to work with. On top of that their professionalism was top notch.  If you want to host a small event without the hassle of cooking, cleaning up before or after, or decorating you need to make your way to H&H and see what they have to offer.  Did I mention the food is A-M-A-Z-I-N-G???  I am originally from Texas so I pride myself on knowing good BBQ when I taste it and it sure it the good stuff.  (I am a HUGE fan of their catfish as well). I know I will have many more events there in the future.   Thank you so much!!!

This is a true Southern BBQ establishment right down to the black-eyed peas and collard greens. The rib tips are meaty, smokey and full of flavor the fried catfish is good but BBQ is there Shining Star. The BBQ platter is enough for 2 people. Check the menu online and do a call in order as they are usually busy around Meal Time. Restaurant itself looks like a converted burger joint not much on atmosphere but worth the trip for the food

We were very disappointed in the ribs and rib tips.  This was the second time we tried this in a week.  They had run out of ribs the first time we went there and they had run out of pulled pork this time.  Sad for a rib place!  The ribs were tough and stringy and the rib tips were overcooked, dry and fatty!  My wife and I did not finish the food and tossed it out.  I would NOT recommend this place to anyone!  There are too many other good BBQ places to go.

Ordered the pork ribs dinner with mac n cheese and potato salad. 
Nice thing about this place is that they have a drive thru! 

Ribs: 3/5 
Ribs were season well and the bbq sauce was good. I only gave it a 3 star because they definitely could've cooked the ribs longer to make them more tender, kinda tough. They also piled on the bbq sauce way to much in the to go container over the ribs. Way to much. 

Mac n cheese: 3/5 
They were house made which was good and cheesy. Good and tasty but no wow factor.

Potato salad: 3/5 
Mustard style potato salad. Had the tang you look for and full of flavor. Again tasty nut no wow factor.

When I arrived here I noticed the place was empty so I was a little apprehensive about going in  but the good ol BBQ smoke coming from outside made me go in!! Upon walking in the place had a fast food set up look w a touch of comfort around w personal pics of what I think was the owner and other people. The menu had lunch and dinner Displaced right in the front. I ordered the rib lunch combo for $9.00. I received a good portion of rib meat and I say rib meat bc it wasn't on a bone like I thought it would be yet it was still good. The BBQ sauce was sweet and tangy and very delish!! My combo came w 2 sides so I order the Mac and cheese which was a lil dry  and the  candied yam. Overall the place  was good, not mind blowing yummy, but decent!!

A group of about 12 stopped at h&h barbecue in the late afternoon on May 21st. I had never been here before and when it was suggested it did not ring a bell at all. They handled all orders quickly and with smiles. I ordered the pork ribs as a change of pace. I loved them. Tasty, tender and fell off the bone. They have kool-aid which really took me back. Several of the guys did have that red magic drink of my youth. I thought the lunch price was very reasonable with the portions and choice of two sides. They also give you a tasty cornbread muffin with lunch or two with the dinner order. I do like barbecue and will be making this one of my many stops in Las Vegas.. They do have a menu with something for everyone..

Still in search for a good non-chain barbecue joint after this place. We ordered beef brisket, mac n cheese, okra, peach cobbler, banana pudding, collars greens, beans. 

The mac n cheese was the highlight of the meal consisting of cheesy creamy goodness. The brisket was dry and bland. It was more of a "sauce show," which is where the flavor originated. Desserts and fried foods were good. Unfortunately, we couldn't try the pulled pork. The cashier said "she" (I'm assuming the owner?) didn't throw any on the pit that morning. Only taking cash that day because the machine was out for repair, we also had to run and get $60 from the ATM for the $47 bill.

Food was good besides that nasty cornbread (too much cornbread batter). They need to go to Walmart and get jiffy cornbread and make right and add some butter but anyways they still better then M&Ms Soul Food.

The food is so awesome. Traditional soul food, but crafted with love and stuff. 

The prices are a bit expensive, but the portions are good and the food is quality. They can be busy at times and their CC system isn't always working and there could be a lengthy wait...

But I keep going back because the food is amazing and the people are nice.

My wife and I greatly enjoyed the food at the original H & H BBQ in north Vegas during a trip to Vegas a few years ago. It was disappointing to learn it shut down sometime this past year.

But it was great to experience this newer version of H & H BBQ! It's really not that far a drive from the strip and the food is well worth the drive! Today, I had the 5 piece fried catfish and it was terrific as I had hoped. Also, this newer place has plenty of room to eat in and it's very clean.

I highly recommend this place if you like BBQ!

About the building: As some others have already stated, its an old Burger King so its a bit awkward inside to say the least. I would encourage that they renovate it a bit just to spruce the place up. Overall, it was pretty clean except for the female restroom. It could use some air freshners and better cleaning care. 

Service: The service was great. The lady who helped me at the front was extremely friendly and very quick and accurate with the orders. I spoke with some of the cooks as well and they were very nice. I love when customer service is up to par...it encourages me to return. 

Food: The food there is delicious! I ordered the catfish, sweet potatoes, and macaroni and cheese. Oh and I can't forget the red Kool-Aid...its just perfect. One thing that they could improve on in this area is the cornbread. Its really dry! I will def be ordering from H&H Plus 2 in the future. I agree that the menu was a bit confusing but nothing major and nothing that the sales clerk can't help with.

Catfish is the best thing here. I've been disappointed with the brisket a couple times now. Learned that the meat is better earlier in the day and gets tougher to chew as time goes on. Cornbread was basically stale and tasted like it was made days ago. We got one on the house for it being the end of the night and a long wait. Whoopdidoo. Maybe throw in something you know will be good? I have been here several times, and it seems to have gotten worse with every visit. It's been months now with the credit/debit card machine down and hand-written bum signs that read "cash only". Every visit is a trial and error with the cashier figuring out the register for how to properly ring in an order. How is a legit business able to do that and why would they want to? Word of advice to the owner- get your business in professional and proper order and it will do much better. I hope it does. I grew up on southern food and want this place to stay around, but needs some improvement. In the meantime, I'll make my own cornbread and get brisket elsewhere.

Food here is off the charts....can't go wrong with this place. Had almost everything on the menu and definitely no complaints here. Added bonus is the service and the ladies are SUPER nice! Go here and get your eat on...you won't be sorry!!

I ordered the 2 meant combo...pork ribs, hot links mac n cheese and collard greens w/ a side of Kool aid (way to sweet) and a small banana pudding. Everything was just OK. Ribs were tender and falling off the bone, but a bit fatty. Greens were a little on the salty side and I couldn't taste anything but pepper in the mac n cheese. Links were good and so was the banana pudding. Can't say I wouldn't recommend this place everyone's taste buds are different.. the customer service was great and the place was very clean.
My new favorite bbq spot. Great food and service. Had the pulled pork. Mac and cheese was bomb and black eyed peas. Im tellin all my friends

This is the second generation of this business.  I'm presently surprised of the food and the service. The food was well done, well presented, and most of all tasty.  I visited this business in its first generation , it had a multitude of issues and dilemmas. Back then the food and service was inconsistent to say the least.  After the fire that destroyed the restaurant and the frequent moves, I stopped patronizing the business.  Then, I moved out of town and far away from Soul Food Eateries, I really missed the convenience of eating soul food that someone else cooked. 
I returned to the Las Vegas area a year ago and still hadn't thought of seeking out H&H Barbecue.  Today, I was invented to a meeting of American Business Woman hosted by H&H Barbecue. What a wonderful surprise to find the former owners in the kitchen, and under new management.  The restaurant looks wonderful, clean, bright and well-organized; in addition, the food was very good.  I will be coming back, for sure.

Perfection 
Chicken, nice and moist. Loved the sauce.
Ranch beans tasted homemade. The fried okra was amazing. The service was great, nice and friendly. We will definitely be coming back! Great price for lunch!

We ordered 2 brisket dinners with mac and cheese and yams. The sides were okay, but the brisket was a pile of inedible, fatty, oily mush covered in bbq sauce. Just nasty and a waste of hard earned money.

Decent bbq......... nice bbq sauce, very nice brisquit, ribs were good, corn on cob was over cooked and dry, coleslaw was ok. NOT CHEAP! with sodas it was $20.00 I got the 2 meat platter with 2 sides. and split it between myself and a friend. The service was good and the place is clean.

I was very excited when I saw a BBQ place nearby to Centennial Hills where I live. Let me start off with the ambiance. It is very sparse but clean. Like other Yelpers have commented, it is a converted BK. You can see the kitchen which is very clean. Honestly, I go for the food and cleanliness. Not the interior decorating. The counter worker was VERY polite, helpful and respectful. It was nice to be treated like guest and not an annoyance. He obviously knew most of the customers and referred to them  by name. And in that time honored Southern tradition, he included, "Miss" before their name. The food. I had pork ribs and asked for the less fatty end cuts. I also asked for sauce on the side. The flavor of the ribs were spot on. Nice smokey flavor, but honestly, they were VERY dry. Dipping them in the delicious sauce improved the flavor but not the texture. As a side note, I want to bathe in their BBQ sauce. It had the perfect Umami for me. For sides I had mac and cheese and black eyed peas. The peas were good once I added a packet of hot sauce. The mac and cheese, while creamy, needed more seasoning. My daughter had the all white meat chicken dinner with mac and cheese and fries. The fries were your basic frozen crinkle cut fry, but they did add some sort of seasoning that the kid liked. She let me try the chicken breast. That too came with sauce on the side. OMG...it was to DIE for. It was so flavorful and perfect. I would order that for myself next time. A big disappointment was the side of corn on the cob that I ordered. It was four dollars and change for a large. I was shocked when I opened the container and literally saw ONE piece of overcooked corn cut in half. I thought for sure for that price I would get at least two whole ears of corn. VERY overpriced. It would have been almost nine dollars for two ears of corn for the kid and I.

I hope the lovely woman who owns the restaurant will read this review. If she would just tweak a few things like perfecting the smoking of the ribs and maybe experimenting with seasonings on the sides. Maybe adding a little bacon or ham hocks when cooking the beans. They really are on to something good, and I really would like to see them succeed.

from the outside and inside appears to be a fast food place. Inside its nothing special. We ordered our food to go. Got home was missing a few items. No need to even mention what we go as none of it was good. There's way better BBQ places within a few miles. Don't bother.

So amazing! I was nervous to try it because it always looks empty but omg. They were out of chicken and brisket. I got hot links, ribs, yams and Mac n cheese and it was freaking delicious, the meat literally fell off the bone it was so moist. Way better than John Mulls!!! I live 2 blocks from here. I found my new home lol I can't wait to go and try everything now
Brisket, pulled pork, catfish with black Eyed peas,  okra and greens.  Like i was teleported to the south.  Very good and friendly service!

excellent BBQ chicken. best BBQ sauce i've had in a long time. 
i was really pleased with everything i tried. my daughter loved the mac & cheese as well. :)

Ok I eat my words, I ate there again and ordered the brisket. Unfortunately this time I was NOT impressed. The brisket was so dry either they served up left over brisket or they were attempting to make jerky. The meat was tough and not edible. Because I liked it so much the first time we went back thinking it was just an"off" day. Hey, it happens right? So, we once again order the brisket and unfortunately got the same results as we did on our previous visit. Tough and dry brisket. Bummer, we thought for sure we found decent BBQ in Vegas. Yet, we were let down once again. Come on Vegas, I know there's gotta be somewhere in town that knows how to slang some good BBQ!!! The hunt for good BBQ in Vegas continues....

I stopped in after being referred by a friend on a sat nite. I hate chain restaurants and what's not to like about a mom & pop southern BBQ joint? I was the only white guy in the whole place which was kinda funny; I don't mind chillin with the brothers. From the accents I could tell a lot of folks in here moved to Vegas from the South. 

There is a sign on the door that says the cc machine is broke. The soda fountain machine was out of service also. The staff also pointed out that they were out of some menu items. These issues lead me to believe business or management isn't good. 

Staff - Lady working behind the counter was more than nice and pleasant. The guy cooking the food complained every time someone placed an order because he didn't want to make it. Those were the only two employees.

Food - Portions are huge but are expensive (one person dinner is $16). After placing my order, the food took approx 20 minutes to arrive. That's way too long. And the food was COLD! I still ate it. I had chicken and mac & cheese. They were flavorful and good, but cold.

Cleanliness - Inside of the restaurant was very clean and well kept.

fella at the counter had a real passion for what he was cookin while describing our options, and the chef had a nice road king out back so I could tell these boys was livin the southern BBQ high life up here in north Las Vegas! puttin some soul in it. the Rib Tips, those collard greens, the hot links, ooooweeeeee. plus the sauce, something about it. didn't try to take over the excellent BBQ, really complimented the meat well and made it better.

Came in Sunday afternoon,  there was a list of items they didnt have. Asked about oxtails and they said no more left. Then the guy after us came in asked and they suddenly had 1 more order. Thats shady!!!  I liked what we ordered but the resturant was ruined by that shady behavior.  Theres many other resturants in Vegas that treat you well and have thier menu items current.

Sad this place is a hit and miss I've been dealing with H&H for years starting at there civic center location loved that place until I seen it on dirty dining decided to give it another try At the new rancho location. Rib tips were very soft including the gristle which tells me it's been just sitting on heat or has been reheated day after day. Yams looked like baby food. Just mad me a little upset that they keep going further into bad business. Please read these comments.

For many years I have been a patron of H&H. At times I've bought hundreds of dollars of ribs and brisket for special occasions. Honestly sides have always been mediocre, so I bought meats and made my own sides. Today I asked my wife to stop by and get brisket. She gets home and she has the most pathetic brisket I've ever seen. Tough, like rubber to chew. No flavor other than the sauce, I was shocked. Never again will I ever buy anything here again.

In the past I've always had a good experience here I just paid $14 for the brisket and it was all fat with just a tiny bit of meat at the end of the fat very disappointing I will be looking elsewhere for good barbecue

Wow, on way through and was looking for sub. Smelled the wood smoker and decided to pop in. I'm a rib guy and these were fantastic. They made the fried okra fresh which was like my grandma made. I could not have been more pleased with the portions as well as the sauce flavor. Outstanding. If you want ribs or a great sandwich this this the place. The ladies working up front were friendly and helpful In Helping us make a choice. 

Trust me this place is great.
Better than famous Daves . I just didn't like the fact that on my last visit the pork was raw .
Customer service and food are awesome...  I recommend the pulled pork, brisket, yams, mac and cheese AND the green beans!

The BBQ is good. The guy behind the counter is funny (I could see how some may find him crass). The only recommendation I have is to stay away from the sweet tea and the kool-aid - too much sugar - and I don't mean it is a little too sweet, the tea and kool-aid are crazy sweet blaaah! Stick with the soda choices

We never knew this place existed despite frequent trips to smith's! Stumbled upon it on Friday and went in for lunch on Saturday. My family and I were excited to see a southern food joint not far from home. 
Our order:
BBQ pork sandwich with fries and slaw on the side
BBQ pork lunch with Mac n cheese and collard greens
BBQ brisket lunch with fried okra and ???
Sadly disappointed, so much I can't remember what the other side was on 
1. Food was either dry, salty, and most of all BBQ meat had no smoky flavor and not enough bbq sauce. I'm not even 
1 who likes a lot of sauce, but food needed it.
Beef brisket Portions nice other then a third of it was fat and so stiff you couldn't even stab it with your fork. BBQ sauce was nice and the ranch beans but that's about all.
BEST BARBQ IVE EVER HAD really good if your looking for original home family reunion bbq !!!

Tried this place a few times, the ribs are excellent, the okras are pleasing, I love the black eyes peas except I find it always is a bit salty! I actually enjoy their food however I might find myself with high blood pressure if I continue to eat here. So my negative is that they ought to tone the level of salt down a bit! I recommend it but ask for no salt!
